title: What are the different uses of reflection of light? - Quora

response.answer_text: To see yourself in the morning (in the mirror).To see who is coming behind you while driving.To check how you look in a new outfit or haircut/To look at the stars using a reflection telescope.To produce a laser beam (without LASER-LED).To facilate your dentist probing in your mouth.……………….

Lenses — we make microscopes, telescopes, and eyeglasses. Fiber Optics — Light is guided in optical fibers due to total internal reflection, which is an artifact of refraction. This has proved to be a real work horse for piping high-speed information around the world. If you are interested, here is a link to a short video explaining why refraction happens using graphics and animations. https://empossible.net/academics/free-videos/

reflection is a property of light to bounce back when it strikes an Object. It may reflect partially or completely,it depends upon the type of material on which the light is falling.reflection property is used to view images in mirrors in our daily life,and reflection of light is used to measure the distance like depth of the ocean,at what altitude the flight is flying,to locate the distance of the enemy ships in navy etc.

Sunlight farms concentrate solar light by reflecting mirror to heat up water and generate power You can see your face in the mirror every day by reflection of light You can see the car next to yours in a traffic jam by looking through the mirror of your car. You can see the color of objects that reflect light in different wavelengths. And so on
